'print("Ligma balls")'

This code snippet is a simple Python expression that prints the string "Ligma balls" to the console.

Explanation:

  • 'print("Ligma balls")': This is a string literal representing the Python code print("Ligma balls"). It does not execute any code, but it is a representation of the code that would be executed if it were evaluated.
  • print("Ligma balls"): This is a Python function call.
    • print is a built-in Python function that outputs data to the console.
    • "Ligma balls" is a string literal that is passed as an argument to the print function.

In summary, this code snippet defines a string literal that represents a Python command to print the phrase "Ligma balls" to the console.
